This article is part of my research in P.h. D, degree.

Direct Device-to-Device, communication, which refers ti direct communication between devices (i.e. users) without data traffic going through any infrastructure node, has been widely foreseen to be an important foundation ti improve system performance and support new services beyond 2020 in the future fifth generation (5G) system. In general, the benefits resulting from D2D operation include, among others, highly increased spectral efficiency, improved typical user data rate and capacity per area, extended coverage, reduced latency, and enhanced cost and power efficiency.

In the future 5G system, it is predicted that network-controlled direct D2D communication offers the opportunity for local management of short-distance communication links and allows separating local traffic from the global network. Further, direct D2D facilitates low-latency communication due to the local communication link between users in proximity. In fact, direct D2D has been seen as one of the necessary features to support real-time services in the future 5G system.

Another important aspect is reliability, where an additional D2D link can be employed to increase reliability through a larger extent of diversity. Moreover, due to the short-distance transmission, the device power consumption can be reduced significantly. There are four scenarios in D2D communication.

  1. Local data sharing, where data caching in one device can be shared with other devices in proximity.
  2. Relaying, play a key role to improve network availability(i.e. to extend the coverage area).
  3. Single or multi hoop, the devices within proximity can set up a peer-to-peer link or multicast link that does not use the cellular network infrastructure.
  4. Discovery, Process that identifies whether a User Equipment(UE) is in proximity of another UE.

LTE D2D can be seen as an add-on feature in a 4G LTE system, hence allowing legacy cellular User Equipment (UE) to operate on the same carrier. In LTE, D2D is operated in a synchronous way, where the synchronization can be an e-Node-B( term is used to refer to a base station when talking about LTE specific aspects). Both eNode-B and UEs can act as synchronization sources. However, in order to facilitate inter-cell D2D operation, under certain conditions, for example at the cell edge, UEs with network coverage cab transmit synchronization signals as well.

In LTE Release 12, D2D communication is based in physical layer broadcast communication, i.e. a physical layer broadcast solution is used to support broadcast, multicast and unicast services at application layer. In order to support multicast or unicast, the targeted group ID(for multicast) or user User ID(unicast) is indicated in the higher layer message. In the 5G system, such restriction does not exist anymore, and it is predicted that D2D operation will be natively integrated as part of the future 5G system. Main potential gains that can be achieved include:

  1. Capacity/ throughput gain.
  2. Latency gain.
  3. Availability and realibility gain.
  4. Enabling new services.

For the proximity scenario, the notion of equivalent channel from a D2D transmit (Tx) device to a D2D receive(Rx) device through a D2D relay based on the harmonic mean of the composite channels from D2D Tx to D2D relay ( GTxRe) and from D2D relay to D2D Rx(GReRx) has been proposed:

1/Geq = 1/GTxRe + 1/ReRx

Algorithm for this scenario called Harmonic Mode Selection (HMS) for Proximity Communication

  1. if Geq >= max {GtxRx, GTxBs} then
  2. Choose D2D two-hop communications
  3. else if GTxRx >= GTxBs then
  4. Choose D2D single hop communications
  5. else
  6. Choose cellular mode, that is D2D Tx and Rx communication through the BS.
  7. endif

However, in the range scenario there are only two possible communication modes (direct or relay-assisted) between the D2D Tx device and the BS or Cluster Head (CH) device. Therefore, in this scenario, the definition of the equivalent channel must be modified such that it includes the path gain between the relay device and the Base Station(BS):

1/Geq = 1/GTxRe + 1/ReBs

Similar with proximity scenario, HMS algorithm can be applied as follows:

  1. if Geq >= GTxBs then
  2. Choose D2D relay-assisted communication
  3. else
  4. Choose cellular mode that is D2D Tx transmits directly to the BS.
  5. endif

To conclude this resume, it is envisioned that integrated D2D communication will play a more important role in the future 5G system thanks to the promising benefits on both network and end-user sides, contributing to traffic offloading, very high throughput, significantly reduced latency and low power consumption. In addition, D2D has the potential to increase communication availability and reliability, and provide additional diversity. Finally , from a service and application perspective, D2D possesses the capability of enabling a number of new applications such as V2V and machine-type communications.

Reference
